rename.from: [Security] Symfony 6 IsGranted attribute ignored at the controller class level
rename.to: [Security] Symfony 6.x IsGranted attribute ignored at the controller class level

body:
https://github.com/symfony/symfony/issues/51361
This behavior is absolutely unexpected when migrating to SF6, a fix is badly needed!
I'm also impacted in many applications that already asked for a painstaking work of migration when moving from 5 to 6.
Thanks @aless673 for reporting it, otherwise I would not have noticed it!

@aless673  I'm not sure about your example / description of the problem, at least in LTS version.

Just created a reproducer with Symfony 6.4 and `IsGranted("ROLE_ADMIN")` works as expected.

-> https://github.com/smnandre/is-granted 

(`composer install` // `symfony serve`)

(i'm not negating there is a problem with expression / args, but simple ROLE_ cases seems to work)

| Homepage | Controller | Controller | Method |
| - | - | - | - |
| ![Capture d’écran 2024-04-10 à 17 16 51](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/assets/1359581/643d726e-62ea-4e41-a55a-0ab88a2cd546) | ![Capture d’écran 2024-04-10 à 17 16 57](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/assets/1359581/285451ec-6b94-4e1e-bdaf-3849787a1b96) | ![Capture d’écran 2024-04-10 à 17 17 03](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/assets/1359581/553bb58f-2eba-497f-9578-bf1c6e64581f) | ![Capture d’écran 2024-04-10 à 17 17 07](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/assets/1359581/5a314e82-f248-4505-a7b7-45fe410ab846) |

@smnandre thank you for taking the time to troubleshoot this issue!

Indeed your simplified reproduction of the case works as expected, it seems that the problem happens in more complex configurations. At the moment I can't find the minimal setup to reproduce the problem and of course I can't publish the whole codebase of the private company applications where the problem occurs.
I'll update this thread with more precise reproduction instructions asap.

Thanks again for your help!

I just found how to reproduce : marking controllers services as lazy

```
    App\Controller\:
        resource: '../src/Controller/'
        lazy: true
```

Without the lazy option, the IsGranted attribute will work as normal

@xabbuh can you confirm the issue
No clue about it no.. as I never considered making my controller lazy to be honest.

issue.title: Symfony 6 IsGranted at the controller level regression
issue.body:
### Description

The following annotation applied at the top of the controller granted access to all controller actions, prior to the deprecation of @Security.

```
/**
 * @Security("is_granted('view', 'PermissionModuleName'))
 */
class SomeController {}
```

To allow the following, equivalent functionality, 

```
#[IsGranted('view', 'PermissionModuleName')]
class SomeController {}
```

change IsGrantedAttributeListener->getIsGrantedSubject() method to 

`return $arguments[$subjectRef] ?? $subjectRef`



### Example

_No response_

body:
This should be fixed, no question about that.

But I'm curious though: what is the reason for registering the controllers as lazy services?

> Seems to be related to ProxyManager and the new Ghost objects. Indeed. | Lazy | Not lazy | | - | - | | | | The attribute is not extracted in the [ControllerArgumentsEvent](https://github.com/symfony/http-kernel/blob/928b6b993debd8e3686d15f96a61cc7ee39e0140/HttpKernel.php#L172)

To fix this, I'd ensure that services with the controller.service_arguments tag are setLazy(false).
No need for more imho. It makes no sense to make controllers lazy but it wouldn't be useful to throw an exception when they are. So let's just take over.
